channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WICKET-7056] HttpSessionStore#getAttribute called on invalidated session
item.description:
The org.apache.wicket.session.HttpSessionStore#getHttpSession does not take an invalidated session state into account.

Thus the e.g. getAttribute method the calls the httpSession#getAttribute which results to the exception being thrown by server (WebSphere and Jetty in our case). See https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/javalangillegalstateexception-thrown-session-manager

In my opinion the HttpSessionStore should check the valid state of the session before trying to access it.

Exception occurred during onEndRequest
java.lang.IllegalStateException: The following session is not valid! FAMtHV-7DvEsvj07hsLKExc

item.environment:
Ubuntu Linux v. 18
WebSphere AS 9.0.5.14
Wicket 8.13.0

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
There is no method for checking whether an HttpSession is valid or not - https://jakarta.ee/specifications/servlet/5.0/apidocs/jakarta/servlet/http/httpsession

Can you reproduce this problem in a quickstart ?

This method https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/api/javax/servlet/http/HttpSession.html#getAttributeNames-- could be used to check the validity of the HttpSession. It raises the IllegalStateException when called on invalid session.

I will prepare the demo app.

mgrigorov I was not able to reproduce this in the demo app. So I've digged deeper and found out the session (invalid) was stored in a thread local variable.

I've also learned, that getSession(false) not only does not create a new session when none exists but also returns a valid session only. If the session has already been invalidated it returns null. So the Wicket code is OK.
Thank you for the update, davesman !
sorry, mgrigorov (reopened due to conflict actions ...)

mgrigorov solomax 

Hello guys!

I found the cause of this problem. I think this issue should be re-opened.

It is a thread synchronization issue in the org.apache.wicket.session.HttpSessionStore#getAttribute method. (and others set, remove, etc.)

 

public final Serializable getAttribute(final Request request, final String name)
{
    HttpSession httpSession = getHttpSession(request, false);
    if (httpSession != null)
    {
        return (Serializable)httpSession.getAttribute(getSessionAttributePrefix(request) + name);
    }
    return null;
}

 

  1. The getHttpSession returns non-null value in case HTTP session exists and is valid and reference to it is stored.
  2. Meanwhile the session is invalidated by another thread (another http request).
  3. The IF condition evaluates still to true and it results in calling httpSession.getAttribute.
  4. Because the session has been invalidated by another thread this call results in IllegalStateException

Methods calling getAttributeNames, removeAttribute, getAttribute, setAttribute should be declared as synchronized or there should be explicit synchronized block inside.

Regards, David
davesman Do you want to send a PR with an improvement ?

mgrigorov I could of course propose the changes as a pull request. But I am unaware how to do it correctly in the ASF world, so please provide some instructions. Thanks, David.

EDIT: I found out ... https://wicket.apache.org/contribute/patch.html

Here is the  documentation - https://wicket.apache.org/contribute/patch.html

You just need to fork https://github.com/apache/wicket and create a PR.

DavesMan opened a new pull request, #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670

… log them

1. The getHttpSession returns non-null value in case HTTP session exists and is valid and reference to it is stored.
2. Meanwhile the session is invalidated by another thread (another http request).
3. The IF condition evaluates still to true and it results in calling httpSession.getAttribute.
4. Because the session has been invalidated by another thread this call results in IllegalStateException

Hello mgrigorov,

I've opened https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670

I decided not to synchronize methods because that could lead to severe P4M impacts. I also could not synchronize on the HttpSession object because containers can return different Java objects for the same session. And moreover ... the session can be invalidated by the container on the background.

So the easiest way with no P4M issues seems to catch thrown exceptions and (DEBUG) log them.

Our banking application works OK with this snapshot but I cannot do any PoC in test environment because the error happens only few times a day in production with hundred of thousand clients... I can verify only in production after 8.16.0 is released.

Just came across this issue more or less accidently when reading the Wicket-Dev mailing list ... why go with this kind of  ugly solution (IMHO exceptions should not be used for control flow) and not just put some custom attribute inside the HttpSession instead and use that for synchronization ?

I stole this idea from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9802165/is-synchronization-within-an-httpsession-feasible

tgierke2342 Because getAttribute throws the IllegalStateException when called on an invalid session. That's what we're discussing here. The J2EE specification is designed the way it is. This (very abstract IMHO) IllegalStateException is used for controlling the app (instead of returning null for example).

I thought of putting some variable inside the Wicket's Session object itself.... but.... this object is also stored as a HTTP session attribute. The very same problem.

I could not find any suitable object for synchronization so far.

DavesMan commented on PR #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670#issuecomment-1752962518

I could not find any situable object to synchronize on.
The HttpSessionStore is one instance per application. Because at least org.apache.wicket.Session#exists() is called in every request,
synchronizing on its instance would mean synchronizing all requests incoming to that application. We have about 1000 requests per second in morning /evening peaks. I think that synchronizing 1000 req/s. one by one would have serious P4M impact.
Synchronization on one single session would be the best solution. But web containers can return different HttpSession object instances per 1 single session.
I even cannot introduce some kind of a lock object and put it in the session as an attribute. Because while calling the getAttribute I could get an IllegalStateException because of invalid session.
I aknowledge that throwing an IllegalStateException as an indication of invalid session is not very nice but so is the J2EE spec.

DavesMan closed pull request #670: WICKET-7056 try-catch attempts to operate on invalid HTTP session and…
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670
davesman My bad, should've looked at the stacktrace ... you obviously cannot use a session attribute when getAttribute() crashing is the issue to solve. Sorry for the noise.

No need to apologize tgierke2342 . If You should have come across some solution in the future, feel free to comment.

But I've noticed that even frameworks like Spring and its https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/javadoc-api/org/springframework/web/util/WebUtils.html#getSessionMutex(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession) do not care about getAttribute throwing this exception.

public static Object getSessionMutex(HttpSession session) {
    Assert.notNull(session, "Session must not be null");
    Object mutex = session.getAttribute(SESSION_MUTEX_ATTRIBUTE);
    if (mutex == null) {
        mutex = session;
    }
    return mutex;
}

This also fails when the session is invalidated between the assertion and the getAttribute call.

martin-g commented on PR #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670#issuecomment-1753018372

Thanks for the explanation!
I wanted to re-open the PR but it seems you already deleted it.
I guess we will come with a similar solution ...

martin-g commented on PR #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670#issuecomment-1753025853

Thanks for restoring it!

DavesMan opened a new pull request, #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670

… log them

1. The getHttpSession returns non-null value in case HTTP session exists and is valid and reference to it is stored.
2. Meanwhile the session is invalidated by another thread (another http request).
3. The IF condition evaluates still to true and it results in calling httpSession.getAttribute.
4. Because the session has been invalidated by another thread this call results in IllegalStateException

DavesMan commented on PR #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670#issuecomment-1753038723

@martin-g I am afraid there is no ideal solution of this problem. It is bad by design of the specs. We can:

1. Sync on some object like the SessionStore and loose performance. Bad.
2. Log the `IllegalStateException` and continue (and hope everyone runs a container that is following the specs).
3. Figure out some snyc object related to the session itself which is not obtained via getAttribute.
4. Build a `ConcurrentHashMap` of locks, keyed by session ID strings inside the HttpSessionStore. Memory intensive and ugly.

bitstorm commented on PR #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670#issuecomment-1753244685

@DavesMan completely agree with our considerations and I also hoped for more "exhaustive" specs about concurrent access to Session object. :-/

martin-g merged PR #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670

martin-g commented on PR #670:

Thank you, @DavesMan !

DavesMan commented on PR #670:
URL: https://github.com/apache/wicket/pull/670#issuecomment-1761123685

Great!

Are You sure mgrigorov about the 8.15.0 fix version? The 8.15.0 has already been released and we were working on the 8.16.0 (still snapshot) version...

 

Any idea when 8.16.0 version is going to be released mgrigorov ? 10.0.0-M2 and 9.16.0 had already been published to Maven repos.

davesman Where did I say anything about 8.15.0 ? The "fixVersion" of this ticket says 8.16.0.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/WICKET-7056?jql=project%20%3D%20WICKET%20AND%20fixVersion%20%3D%208.16.0 contains only this issue. We wait for some more fixes before cutting a release. Not sure when it will be released.

I've edited my previous comment. You changed the version on 13th October. It was 8.15 before.

OK. We have to wait then. Or make our own fork build.
